attributes.action: pay the Daily Telegraph £150,000 out of the public purse to compensate it for its expenses incurred in promoting transparency in our political system.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The original intention of Parliament was that details of MPs' expense claims would be released during the summer of 2009 when Parliament was in recess in the hope that it would all have been conveniently forgotten by the time Parliament reconvened in September. 

The Daily Telegraph paid out £150,000 to put this information into the public domain with immediate effect. We the public are grateful to the Daily Telegraph for this and ask that their expenses so incurred should be reimbursed as a sign of the UK Parliament's desire for honesty and transparency of the political system.

We ask further that announcement of this payment should  made by the Prime Minister immediately upon the election of a new Speaker of the House of Commons.
